WE SERVICE ALL OF OXFORD COUNTY, LONDON, WOODSTOCK, TILLSONBURG, STRATFORD, KITCHENER, WATERLOO, CAMBRIDGE, BRANTFORD, SIMCOE, AND EVERYTHING IN BETWEEN.


Located in Ingersoll, Ontario, Done Right Duct Cleaning is an authentic, professional, and ethical duct cleaning company specializing in customer service and efficiency. From the scheduling of the job, to the on-time service, we know you will be impressed with the competence and honest nature of our team. We take great pride in our work, and great care in your home. We understand that “word of mouth” is the best form of advertising, so rest assured that you and your home are in good hands with Done Right Duct Cleaning.


We are a growing name in the community, and we are here to stay. Keep an eye our social media platforms (Instagram, Facebook) for upcoming events and deals.
services:
DUCT CLEANING
Every time your furnace or air conditioner runs, all of the air in your home travels through the air duct system, recirculating contaminants like dust, dirt, dander, pollens, mold spores, dust mites, and other allergens. Clean ductwork means clean air, which directly translates to less dust in the house, more efficient heating and cooling, and easier breathing. Dusty ductwork also absorbs moisture out of the air. A dry home makes you more susceptible to colds and other sicknesses. Proper duct cleaning will reduce allergies and asthma, as well as the frequency of house cleaning.

Enjoy your time indoors. Contact us to get your ducts cleaned today and take a breath of fresh of air tomorrow.
FURNACE & AIR CONDITIONER CLEANING
Dust builds up in your furnace, which greatly reduces airflow. As a result, your furnace will work harder and run longer to move the air. This puts a lot of stress on the furnace and will reduce its lifetime and efficiency. A thorough furnace cleaning will greatly increase efficiency and airflow through your house.
DRYER VENT CLEANING
Dryer vent cleaning will extend the life expectancy of your dryer and reduce the risk of fire. Most dryer fires are caused by dirty dryer exhaust vents.

In addition, the clothes dryer uses a lot of hydro, and a clean dryer vent will lower hydro costs and dry your clothes faster, thus saving you time and money.

profile:
Air Busters Air Duct Cleaning is NADCA Certified (National Air Duct Cleaning Association) and employs a full time CVI, Certified Ventilation Inspector. NADCA’s CVI certification is an advanced certification to recognize industry professionals involved in the inspection and cleaning HVAC systems.
***
The ASCS designation recognizes the comprehensive knowledge in the field of ventilation cleaning.  NADCA members have agreed to conduct their Air Duct Cleaning business in accordance with a strict, mandatory Code of Ethics.
***
Air Busters residential air duct cleaning has cleaned houses of any size from some as small as 800 square feet up to a home of 60,000 square feet.
***
Air Busters Air Duct Cleaning is a family owned and operated business.  We promise to build this business on a foundation of honesty, integrity, and accountability.  We fully adhere to the high standards of HVAC cleaning, as set by NADCA, and will treat our customers and their homes with the utmost of respect.

Windsor Location- 519-969-2222
London- 226-210-8721
Kitchener Location - 226-212-1587
services:

specialities:
Air Busters Code of Ethics
Home/Air Busters Code of Ethics
Adhering to the highest standards
We will serve our customers with integrity and competence.
We will perform our work using Source Removal methods.
We will be honest and forthright in our advertising.
We will provide our clients with accurate inspections and evaluations of the cleanliness and physical condition of their HVAC systems, using this information to determine the type of cleaning and maintenance services required, if any.
We will provide only necessary and desired services to our clients, and will not use furnace/air duct cleaning as a means of selling unnecessary or unwanted products or services.
We will provide services only after completing the necessary bonding and licensing procedures.
We will utilize the services and products of those who possess specialized skills, tools, or trades not possessed by us when circumstances call for work to be done which we are unable to perform.
We will stay abreast of new developments in technology, tools of the trade, building codes, the Uniform Mechanical Code, and any other codes or information that directly affects our work.
We will require that all employees of our firm practice furnace/air duct cleaning in accordance with NADCA Guidelines and the Code of Ethics.
We will perform our services in accordance with the current published standards of the association.
